summary: This is a court order from Judge John G. Koeltl in the Southern District of New York regarding a civil case (20-cv-484) where Jane Doe sued Darren K. Indyke and others. The order grants Ghislaine Maxwell's request to have $13.70 in costs taxed against the plaintiff, as Maxwell was deemed the prevailing party after the plaintiff dismissed the action against her with prejudice.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: The plaintiff who filed the civil action against Darren K. Indyke and others, and who dismissed the action against Ghislaine Maxwell with prejudice.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named defendant in the civil case filed by Jane Doe, though the order specifically addresses costs related to co-defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-defendant who sought to have $13.70 in costs taxed against the plaintiff after the plaintiff dismissed the action against her with prejudice; the court found she was the prevailing party.

persons.name: John G. Koeltl
persons.context: The judge who issued the order granting Ghislaine Maxwell's request for costs and determining she was the prevailing party.

connections.description: Plaintiff and defendant in a civil lawsuit; Doe dismissed the action against Maxwell with prejudice, leading to Maxwell being deemed the prevailing party.
Plaintiff and defendant in the civil lawsuit referenced in the court order.
Co-defendants in the civil lawsuit filed by Jane Doe.

events.title: Plaintiff's Counsel Letter Submission
events.description: Counsel for plaintiff Jane Doe submitted a letter indicating that if the court was inclined to grant Maxwell's request for costs, the plaintiff would send the $13.70.

events.title: Court Order Granting Costs to Maxwell
events.description: Judge John G. Koeltl issued an order granting Ghislaine Maxwell's request to have $13.70 in costs taxed against plaintiff Jane Doe, affirming Maxwell as the prevailing party.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was deemed the 'prevailing party' in a civil lawsuit after the plaintiff, Jane Doe, dismissed the action against her with prejudice.
Maxwell sought and was granted $13.70 in costs to be paid by the plaintiff, a minimal amount indicating procedural costs.
The case is identified as 20-cv-484 (JGK) in the Southern District of New York, showing it was part of ongoing civil litigation involving Epstein associates.
The order references a prior court finding (ECF No. 98) that Maxwell was a prevailing party, indicating previous litigation on this issue.
